subject: Communication
title: The Collaboration Ideal
description: A fast breakdown of The Collaboration Ideal for builders.

hook.text: Two departments demand the same budget. Instead of splitting it, they merge projects and deliver twice the value.

buildup.text: Collaboration is the only style where both assertiveness and cooperativeness are high. Win-win, not compromise.

discovery.text: Unlike compromise (both give up something), collaboration finds solutions where both parties get what they truly need.

twist.text: Collaboration takes the most time and emotional energy. That's why most people default to quicker, less optimal styles.

climax.text: The payoff is worth it: collaborative solutions are more durable, creative, and relationship-preserving.

punchline.text: Compromise splits the pie. Collaboration makes a bigger one.

quiz.question: How does collaboration differ from compromise?
options: Collaboration finds solutions where both parties fully win
